record.field: 1. Which of the following is not a factor that affects PRT?
B. Presence of alchol in driver’s system
2. Within which field of vision should traffic signs be placed without the drivers having to change their line of sight?
3. What is the correct order of the four distinct processes a driver has to perform during perception and reaction time?
A. Detection, Identification, Decision and Response
B. Detection, Decision, Identification and Response
C. Identification, Detection, Decision and Response
D. Identification, Deciison, Detection and Response
4. The Peripheral vision field narrows as speed decreases.
5. What is the range of fairly clear vision cone?
6. Some _______ pigment has been added to green lights and some ________ pigment has been added to red light to make it easier for the colourblind drivers to distinguish it.
7. Glare effects can be minimized by decreasing the height of lights
8. What do Raised markers on a pavement indicate?
B. Mandatory reduction in speed of the vehicle
9. Which visual reception affects the ability of a driver to estimate speed, distance, size, and acceleration?
10. What is the recovery time when the driver moves from light to dark condition?
11. What does the etching on the outside edge of the shoulder on a highway pavement indicate to a driver?
A. Vehicle leaving the pavement surface
B. Vehicle entering a different lane
C. Vehicle entering a construction site
D. Vehicle entering the pedestrian lan
12. The cone for peripheral vision is typically 160°. On what does this value depend on?
A. Speed of vehicle and hearing perception
B. Speed of vehicle and age of driver
C. Age of driver and depth perception
D. Age of driver and glare recovery
A. Minimum gap required to change the lane safely
B. Maximum gap required to change the lane safely
C. Minimum gap required in between parked cars
D. Maximum gap required in between parked cars
14. The visibility difficulty that the driver faces at night is due to ________________
15. The difference in between the set of front axle and rear axle while negotiating a horizontal curve is called ___________
16. The difference in between the set of front axle and rear axle while negotiating a horizontal curve is called ___________
17. A wheel base of 6.5m negotiates a 35m curve find the off tracking?
18. In a braking test, a vehicle was moving with a speed of 45kmph and was stopped by applying brakes, the skid marks were 10.0m in length. Determine the skid resistance
19. How many types of factors affect traffic characteristics?
20. The hearing, visibility and reaction time are covered in which type of factors?
21. An intelligent driver who consumed alcohol will have a chance of __________
22. The stability of a vehicle is influenced by _________
A. Width of wheel base only
B. Width of wheel base and height of gravity
C. secHeight of gravity only onds
23. The height of the vehicle mainly influences?
24. The minimum number of parameters needed to measure brake efficiency is?
25. If the acceleration of the vehicle is 6.17m/sec2 then the average skid resistance is?
26. The number of vehicles crossing a section of road in a unit time at any selected period is called ______.
27. WhSpeed studies are conducted for what primary purpose?at
28. Which traffic study studies the effectiveness of various traffic control devices?
29. The time lost by traffic due to traffic friction and traffic control devices is called _____
30. Traffic islands are used to increase the length of the crossing
